intro: Schizachyrium, commonly known as little bluestem, is a genus of grasses native to North America. It is characterized by its fine, blue-gray foliage and its ability to thrive in dry, open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and is often found in prairies and disturbed soils. Schizachyrium species are known for their ornamental value and are used in landscaping for their drought tolerance and aesthetic appeal. They also play an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for wildlife.
